sources.title: Tennessee Department of Labor and Workforce Development

nonCompete.detailedExplanation: Tennessee courts favor reasonable employer restrictions using 6-factor balancing test. Non-competes protecting legitimate business interests typically upheld. 1-2 years generally reasonable. Courts will enforce if protecting confidential information, customer relationships, or specialized training.
nonCompete.suggestion: Non-competes are enforceable - use 1-2 year duration with reasonable scope
nonCompete.actionRequired: Ensure reasonableness in time and scope
nonCompete.alternativeLanguage: non-compete restrictions protecting legitimate business interests (enforceable in Tennessee)
nonCompete.source: Tennessee Supreme Court - Hasty v. Rent-A-Driver

salaryHistory.detailedExplanation: Tennessee has no law prohibiting salary history questions

payTransparency.detailedExplanation: No requirement to disclose salary ranges

backgroundChecks.message: Background checks permitted at any stage
backgroundChecks.detailedExplanation: No ban-the-box law. Criminal history inquiries permitted on applications. Follow federal FCRA.

minimumWage.message: Tennessee has NO state minimum wage - federal $7.25 applies
minimumWage.detailedExplanation: Tennessee does not have state minimum wage law. Federal minimum wage of $7.25/hour applies under FLSA.

paidLeave.detailedExplanation: Tennessee does not require paid sick leave, paid family leave, or vacation

drugScreening.detailedExplanation: Tennessee allows drug testing and encourages drug-free workplace programs. Certified programs provide workers' compensation premium discounts.
drugScreening.bestPractice: Consider certified drug-free workplace program for workers' comp discounts

atWill.detailedExplanation: Tennessee is very employer-friendly at-will state with limited exceptions
atWill.suggestion: Strong at-will language is legally protective

arbitration.detailedExplanation: Tennessee follows FAA. Arbitration clauses generally enforceable.

finalPay.message: Final wages due next regular payday or within 21 days
finalPay.detailedExplanation: Final wages must be paid by next regular payday or within 21 days of separation, whichever occurs later.
finalPay.requirement: Pay by next payday or within 21 days

rightToWork.message: Tennessee is a RIGHT TO WORK state
rightToWork.detailedExplanation: Union membership and dues cannot be required as condition of employment

breaks.message: Meal breaks REQUIRED for 6+ hour shifts
breaks.detailedExplanation: Employees scheduled to work 6+ consecutive hours must receive unpaid meal or rest period of at least 30 minutes. Does not apply if workplace nature provides ample opportunity to rest or take breaks.
breaks.actionRequired: Implement meal break policy complying with state law
